intro: Sphagneticola trilobata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Sphagneticola trilobata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
